title: Akron Beacon Journal - Wikipedia
snippet: The McClatchy Company bought Knight Ridder in June 2006 with intentions of selling 12 Knight Ridder newspapers. On August 2, 2006, McClatchy sold the Beacon Journal to Black Press. In 2018, GateHouse Media bought the newspaper. On November 11, 2013, the Akron Beacon Journal printed its last ...

title: Akron Beacon Journal sold to GateHouse Media | Crain's Cleveland Business
snippet: GateHouse Media has purchased the Akron Beacon Journal and its website, Ohio.com, from Black Press Group Ltd.

title: Akron Beacon Journal
snippet: In August 2006, Black Press Ltd., a Canadian media company, acquired the Akron Beacon Journal from McClatchy Co. for $165 million, marking a shift to foreign ownership amid early signs of U.S.

title: Black Press buys Akron Beacon Journal for $165 million - Poynter
snippet: Akron Beacon Journal The Akron Beacon Journal will become the largest newspaper owned by the private, family-owned Black Press of British Columbia, Canada. The Beacon Journal, with a Sunday circulation of about 179,000, is about twice the size of Black Pressâ€™ largest paper, the Honolulu ...

title: Gatehouse Media purchases Akron Beacon Journal - cleveland.com
snippet: We will expect nothing less from the Beacon, as the institution enters the next chapter of its long history in the Akron community." The Beacon was purchased in 2006 for $165 million by Black Press Group, a Canadian publisher.
